website_summaries.verdict: While not dubbed "waterproof," this tear-, grease-, and water-resistant paper is good for many moist or outdoor settings.
pros: Prints well in a laser printer like a normal piece of paper
A good product for outdoor applications like maps, posters, or geocaching
Doesn't get brittle or crack over time
Can be printed on both sides
cons: If you cut or hole punch this paper it may be more prone to tear in the areas near the cuts

customer_reviews.title: Meh, not what I expected...
customer_reviews.text: Used for brochures and other marketing materials. I've used HP tough paper, and prefer it over this polyester paper. This will print out very flimsy and curls. Almost seems as if it were cheap brochure paper. However, it does hold its own and will not tear or crack. Seems to hold up to UV as well.
customer_reviews.author: brandon

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with the results using this paper with my Samsung color laser printer. The print is water resistant as stated. I tested a few small spills which were gently wiped up with no damage. I also noticed that the very fine print was much sharper than when using regular 24# paper. It is definitely tear resistant. With the price per sheet of slightly more than $.30 I won't be using it for all my printing (though I wish I could). Good value.
customer_reviews.author: Tom in Germantown

customer_reviews.title: Great paper, very durable, could be more gritty.
customer_reviews.text: The paper is exactly what it needs to be, though it can be a bit lacking in grit needed to use with Frixion erasable pen (we use this paper for D&D) Don’t bother using with inkjet, you’ll lose a LOT of ink. Pigment inks don’t adhere at all.
customer_reviews.author: M. Watson

customer_reviews.title: Durable Synthetic Paper
customer_reviews.text: These polyester sheets are great for laser printing maps and activity sheets to be used outside or to be roughly handled. Ballpoint pens write well on it, even when wet. Permanent markers may or may not smudge. Pencil smears easily, but that's somewhat expected. The only problem is that this material does not fold well. Making pamphlets and binding books that lie flat requires the use of high power presses because the fibers are too strong for that application.
customer_reviews.author: Human from New Jersey

customer_reviews.title: Works great. But when using an inkjet printer it takes ...
customer_reviews.text: I honestly thought it would have more of a cloth feel, but it's definitely paper textured. Doesn't rip. Works great. But when using an inkjet printer it takes a longgg while to fully dry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This paper works really well. If you cut it ...
customer_reviews.text: This paper works really well. If you cut it, or hole punch it, then there is less integrity in the paper in those areas. But it surely cannot be torn when it is a whole sheet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very durable and kid/weather friendly
customer_reviews.text: Needed a durable water proof paper for Boy Scouts. Works very well for us.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thank you!
customer_reviews.text: More than happy! Great price and quick international delivery! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Billie McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Amazing. Used this for outdoor signs
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. Used this for outdoor signs. Lasted over 6 months with little or no fading!
customer_reviews.author: Julie Borneman

customer_reviews.title: good quality no tear paper
customer_reviews.text: this product is used in a manufacturing setting and holds up perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: JKM

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love love this paper. Does not tear and its waterproof!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia

customer_reviews.title: If you have a need for paper that doesn't tear ...
customer_reviews.text: If you have a need for paper that doesn't tear with constant use, this is it! A little pricey but for heavily used printed material that isn't updated frequently, I have found this to be well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: MyGoTo place

customer_reviews.title: Excellent in our Garden Center
customer_reviews.text: We use this throughout our Garden Center for signage, display information, etc. It doesn't yellow, get brittle, or warp. It outlasts any ink printed on it and is durable season after season
customer_reviews.author: Don V.

customer_reviews.title: Great paper!
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I was looking for!! Also, the packaging was great and was delivered on time. I would recommend this paper to anyone who need a non-tear paper product.
customer_reviews.author: megal

customer_reviews.title: but arrived in poor condition. Two corners were damaged in the stack
customer_reviews.text: Paper works as described, but arrived in poor condition. Two corners were damaged in the stack.
customer_reviews.author: ton

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff
customer_reviews.text: Indistinguishable from Duracopy No. 6511 that sells for over $60 on Amazon. I've got both in the office and have used the Duracopy for 30 years in the field both above and below the water in every condition imaginable (replaced the Rite in the Rain All-Weather long ago) as a biologist and engineer. I frequently copy design drawings and data sheets onto the paper using a laser printer, which has never failed in the field, regardless of weather.
customer_reviews.author: Nick P.

product_meta.title: Xerox Polyester Paper 4.7 mil, 8.5" x 11", 100 Sheets/Box (3R12363)
product_meta.description: Xerox Polyester Paper 4.7 mil (8.5" x 11") (100 Sheets/Box). Durable Product. Meets the customer requirements. This product is manufactured in Japan.
feature_bullets: Wet weather chemicals and tearing don't mean a thing to this tough paper? Xerox Polyester Paper is designed to take plenty of abuse and still look great
Xerox Polyester Paper 4.7 mil (8.5" x 11") (100 Sheets/Box)
